column4: Anybody knows how I can download a specific .deb through the universe repository through windows/firefox . I 'm not able to use apt-get or aptitude under ubuntu, something in my networking is broken.
packages.ubuntu.com, then once you find the packages, down near the bottom theres a table with the different arches, click the arch, and select a mirror
that's expected.  Ubuntu uses the debian apache config structure
can you help me , I'm trying to set http://wiki.apache.org/httpd/CouldNotDetermineServerName right, so I can restart & stop apache without issues
its going to be a local thing, just to see some stuff.
Add it to apache2.conf

apache2.conf is where serverwide configs go, then module configs go in their respective .conf files in mods-available, and virtualhost specific things go in their repsective VH files in sites-available
can I do something like ServerName shirish.example.com (it just needs any damn name or something in particular) ?
yeah, it should be somewhere that you can be found, whether thats a local thing (subnet IP) or a dyndns address, or whatnot
is it ok to talk in private? That way I can know what to do , I just want to play around with stuff, nothing big
Is this on a separate computer you've got on your LAN? (your private server) or is it your desktop that you're running apache on and'll be accessing it from that computer only?
the second one, a single desktop I'm running apache on & I'll be accessing from this computer only.
Alright, then go ahead and use 127.0.0.1 for your IP
Flynsarmy: guys this is what I've done at http://pastebin.ca/754669 is that good enough?
/etc/hostname has the name Mugglewille
but /etc/hosts doesn't I imagine
with the d?
are u saying I should remove the d?
That second line should read: 127.0.0.1 M...whatever
Ok will do the changes.
corrected, thanx
